sn37.5:1.1: Then Venerable Anuruddha went up to the Buddha, sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn37.5:1.2: “Sometimes, sir, with my clairvoyance that’s purified and superhuman, I see that a female—when her body breaks up, after death—is reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
sn37.5:1.3: How many qualities do females have so that they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?”
sn37.5:2.1: “Anuruddha, when females have five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
sn37.5:2.3: They’re faithless, shameless, imprudent, irritable, and witless.
sn37.5:2.4: When females have these five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
